metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2384 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) componentin Oracle Java SE 7 Update 17 and earlier, 6 Update 43 and earlier, and 5.0Update 41 and earlier; and OpenJDK 6 and 7; allows remote attackers toaffect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectorsrelated to 2D, a different vulnerability than CVE-2013-1569, CVE-2013-2383,and CVE-2013-2420. NOTE: the previous information is from the April 2013CPU. Oracle has not commented on claims from another vendor that this issueis related to "font layout" in the International Components for Unicode(ICU) Layout Engine before 51.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2384` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libicu52 - 52.1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icu package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '52.1-3').
